it.unibo.alchemist.core.interfaces

Interface IDependencyGraph<T>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - The parametrization type for reactions
    All Superinterfaces:
    Serializable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    DependencyGraph

    public interface IDependencyGraph<T>
extends Serializable
    This interface allows to separate the usage of a dependency graph from its implementation.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addNeighbor(INode<T> n1, INode<T> n2)
      Given two nodes, the graph assumes they are now neighbors and calculates the neighborhood dependencies between them.
      void createDependencies(IDependencyHandler<T> rh)
      This method creates the dependencies when a new reaction is added to the environment.
      void removeDependencies(IDependencyHandler<T> rh)
      This method removes all the dependencies (both in and out dependencies) for a given reaction handler.
      void removeNeighbor(INode<T> n1, INode<T> n2)
      Given two nodes, the engine assumes they are no longer neighbors and deletes the neighborhood dependencies between them.

    • Method Detail

      • addNeighbor

        void addNeighbor(INode<T> n1,
                 INode<T> n2)
        Given two nodes, the graph assumes they are now neighbors and calculates the neighborhood dependencies between them.
        Parameters:
        n1 - The first node
        n2 - The second node

      • createDependencies

        void createDependencies(IDependencyHandler<T> rh)
        This method creates the dependencies when a new reaction is added to the environment. Please be careful when building the environment and populating the existing reactions map: this method assumes that all the dependencies among the existing reactions are correct and up to date.
        Parameters:
        rh - the reaction handler whose dependencies should be calculated.

      • removeDependencies

        void removeDependencies(IDependencyHandler<T> rh)
        This method removes all the dependencies (both in and out dependencies) for a given reaction handler. This method is meant to be used in order to keep the dependencies clean when removing a reaction.
        Parameters:
        rh - the reaction handler whose dependencies will be deleted.

      • removeNeighbor

        void removeNeighbor(INode<T> n1,
                    INode<T> n2)
        Given two nodes, the engine assumes they are no longer neighbors and deletes the neighborhood dependencies between them.
        Parameters:
        n1 - The first node
        n2 - The second node
